Juris Doctor
agency:
Used by those who have earned their Juris Doctor degree either alone or in 
conjunction with other post-nominal letters. Its use by non-attorneys is 
not restricted.

name: Esquire
agency:
Used by attorneys who have been admitted to the bar. Its use by 
non-attorneys may be restricted by state bar associations (see unauthorized 
practice of law)When Esq. is used it should stand on its own.

name: Bachelor of Civil Law
agency:
Used by English-language universities for various degrees in law. 
Historically, it originated as a postgraduate degree in the universities of 
Oxford and Cambridge, but many universities now offer the BCL as an 
undergraduate degrees

name: Board Certified Civil Trial Attorney
agency: National Board of Legal Specialty Certification

agency: National Board of Legal Specialty Certification

agency: NALS (formerly the National Association of Legal Secretaries)

name: Professional Legal Secretary
agency: NALS (formerly the National Association of Legal Secretaries)

name: Professional Paralegal
agency: NALS (formerly the National Association of Legal Secretaries)

name: Master of Laws
agency:
Used by attorneys who have also completed a related master's degree, 
usually a specialization. Its use by non-attorneys is not restricted.

agency:
APICS American Production & Inventory Control Society 

((Certified Supply Chain Professional )) CSCP (( APICS))

name: Certified in Logistics, Transportation and Distribution
agency: APICS American Production & Inventory Control Society

name: American Board of Professional Psychology
agency:
Qualification beyond state licensure currently in 13 specialties, including 
clinical, school, and forensic psychology

name: Certified Genetic Counselor
agency:
*The American Board of Genetic Counseling (ABGC)* is the credentialing 
organization for the genetic counseling profession in the United States and 
Canada. The ABGC certifies and recertifies qualified genetic counseling 
professionals. In this way, the work of the ABGC protects the public and 
promotes the ongoing growth and development of the genetic counseling 
profession.[12]

name: Certified Health Education Specialist
agency: National Commission for Health Education Credentialing, Inc.

name: Master Certified Health Education Specialist
agency: National Commission for Health Education Credentialing, Inc.

name: Master of Public Health
agency:
Accredited through the Council on Education for Public Health. Focuses on 
public health practice (rather than research) and includes health education 
and epidemiology.

name: Certified HIPAA Privacy Associate
agency:
Basic level certification for covered entities and business associates 
employees, interns, volunteers and others.

name: Certified HIPAA Privacy Expert
agency:
Intermediate level certification for covered entities and business 
associates employees who need to validate their HIPAA Privacy knowledge. 
This certification is mainly for HR staff, privacy consultants and Privacy 
compliance team members.

name: Certified HIPAA Privacy Security Expert
agency:
Highest level of certification for covered entities and business associates 
HIPAA compliance officer who need to validate their HIPAA Privacy & 
Security knowledge. This certification is mainly for compliance staff, 
HIPAA consultants, HIPAA auditors and HIPAA Compliance officer.

name: Certified Hospice and Palliative Licensed Nurse
agency:
must hold a current, unrestricted practical/vocational nurse license in the 
United States or its territories and must have hospice and palliative 
licensed practical/vocational nursing practice of 500 hours in the most 
recent 12 months or 1000 hours in the most recent 24 months prior to 
applying for the examination.[13]

name: Certified HIPAA Security Expert
agency:
Intermediate level certification for covered entities and business 
associates employees who need to validate their HIPAA Security knowledge. 
This certification is mainly for IT staff, security consultants and 
Security compliance team members.

name: Doctor of Chiropractic
agency: A professional doctoral degree for chiropractic physicians.

name: Doctor of Psychology
agency:
A professional doctoral degree for clinical psychologists. Clinical 
psychologists who complete additional research as a component of their 
academic training are awarded a PhD in Psychology. Either of these degrees 
may be listed postnominally with ABPP to designate completion of board 
specialization beyond licensure.

name: Doctor of Naturopathic Medicine
agency:
A professional doctoral degree for naturopathic practitioners in the United 
States. Holders of the ND or NMD degree are known as naturopathic 
physicians in states where they may be licensed. The designation NMD is 
used in Arizona.

name: Doctor of Nursing Practice
agency:
A terminal professional degree that focuses on the clinical aspects of 
nursing rather than academic research. The curriculum for the DNP degree 
generally includes advanced practice, leadership, and application of 
clinical research. The DNP is intended primarily to prepare registered 
nurses to become advanced practice registered nurses. Advanced practice 
roles in nursing include the nurse practitioner (NP), certified registered 
nurse anesthetist (CRNA), certified nurse midwife (CNM), the clinical nurse 
specialist (CNS), and Nursing Administrators.

name: Doctor of Optometry
agency: A professional doctoral degree for Optometrists

name: Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine
agency:
A professional doctoral degree for physicians in the United States. Holders 
of the DO degree are known as osteopathic physicians and have equivalent 
rights, privileges, and responsibilities as physicians with a Doctor of 
Medicine degree (M.D.). Osteopathic medical school curricula closely mirror 
those of Doctor of Medicine M.D.-granting medical schools. However, 
osteopathic physicians also receive an additional 300 – 500 hours in the 
study of hands-on manual medicine and the body's musculoskeletal system 
integrated into the medical curriculum, which is referred to as osteopathic 
manipulative medicine.

name: Doctor of Podiatric Medicine
agency:
A Doctor of Podiatric Medicine (DPM) is a physician that specializes in 
diagnosing and treating conditions of the foot, ankle, and related 
structures of the leg. DPMs are also known as podiatric physicians or 
surgeons. They complete four years of training in a podiatric medical 
school and three years of hospital residency training. This training is 
similar to that of other medical or osteopathic doctors but with an 
emphasized scope on foot, ankle, and lower extremity.

name: Emergency Medical Dispatcher
agency:
Certified through the Association of Public-Safety Communications 
Officials-International (APCO), the National Academies of Emergency 
Dispatch, and PowerPhone, Inc.

name: Nationally Registered Emergency Medical Responder (Begin January 1, 2012)
agency:
All require passage of the National EMS Certification Exam-EMR (NREMR), 
developed by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians

name: Emergency Medical Technician - Basic (End December 31, 2011)
agency:
All require passage of the National Registry of Emergency Medical 
Technicians EMT-Basic Exam (NREMT-B), developed by the National Registry of 
Emergency Medical Technicians

name: Nationally Registered Emergency Medical Technician (Begin January 1, 2012)
agency:
All require passage of the National EMS Certification Exam-EMT (NREMT), 
developed by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians

name: Emergency Medical Technician - Intermediate/85 (End March 31, 2013)
agency:
All require passage of the National Registry of Emergency Medical 
Technicians EMT-Intermediate/85 Exam (NREMT-I/85), developed by the National 
Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians

name: Emergency Medical Technician - Intermediate/99 (End December 31, 2013)
agency:
All require passage of the National Registry of Emergency Medical 
Technicians EMT-Intermediate/99 Exam (NREMT-I/99), developed by the National 
Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians

name:
Nationally Registered Advanced Emergency Medical Technician (Begin June 1, 
2011)
agency:
All require passage of the National EMS Certification Exam-Advanced EMT 
(NRAEMT), developed by the National Registry of Emergency Medical 
Technicians

name: Emergency Medical Technician - Paramedic (End December 31, 2012)
agency:
All require passage of the National Registry of Emergency Medical 
Technicians EMT-Paramedic Exam (NREMT-P), developed by the National 
Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians

name: Nationally Registered Paramedic (Begin January 1, 2013)
agency:
All require passage of the National EMS Certification Exam-Paramedic (NRP), 
developed by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians

name: Licensed Paramedic (Texas)
agency:
Licensure by Texas Department of State Health
All require passage of the National Registry of Emergency Medical 
Technicians- EMT-Paramedic or National EMS Certification Exam-Paramedic 
(NREMT-P or NRP after January 1, 2013), developed by the National Registry 
of Emergency Medical Technicians
All require an associate degree in emergency medical services (EMS), a 
baccalaureate degree, or a postgraduate degree

agency:

name: Doctor of Theology
agency:

theological seminary or university. At those institutions offering it, it 
is considered a terminal degree in academic theology (at other institutions 
it is the PhD or DPhil in theology).

name: Doctor of Ministry
agency:
Used by those who have earned a professional doctorate degree at a 
theological seminary or university.

name: Master of Theology
agency:
Used by those who have earned a master in academic studies at a theological 
seminary or university.

name: Master of Divinity
agency:
Used by those who have earned a professional master's degree at a 
theological seminary or university. Although it is a master's degree, 
academic completion requires 3 years of graduate training and it is 
considered a terminal degree in this field.

name: Master of Theological Studies
agency:
Used by those who have earned a master's degree at a theological seminary 
or university.

agency:
Used by those who have earned a master in academic studies at a theological 
seminary or university.

name: Master of Divinity
agency:
Used by those who have earned a professional master's degree at a 
theological seminary or university. Although it is a master's degree, 
academic completion requires 3 years of graduate training and it is 
considered a terminal degree in this field.

name: Master of Theological Studies
agency:
Used by those who have earned a master's degree at a theological seminary 
or university.
